intro: Trichomanes calyculatum, commonly known as the golden tamarisk, is a rare and ancient fern species belonging to the family Hymenophyllaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, lace-like fronds that are typically less than 10 centimeters in length. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its spores are produced in small, clustered structures called sorus, which are located on the underside of the fronds. Trichomanes calyculatum is noted for its ecological significance in maintaining biodiversity in its native habitats.
